trans-unit.source: Real-time Twitter sentiment analysis with Stream Analytics | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Real-time Twitter sentiment analysis with Stream Analytics | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Stream Analytics for real-time Twitter sentiment analysis. Step-by-step guidance from event generation to data on a live dashboard.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Stream Analytics for real-time Twitter sentiment analysis. Step-by-step guidance from event generation to data on a live dashboard.

trans-unit.source: In this tutorial, you'll learn how to build a sentiment analysis solution by bringing real-time Twitter events into Event Hubs, writing Stream Analytics queries to analyze the data, and then storing the results or using a dashboard to provide insights in real time.
trans-unit.target: In this tutorial, you'll learn how to build a sentiment analysis solution by bringing real-time Twitter events into Event Hubs, writing Stream Analytics queries to analyze the data, and then storing the results or using a dashboard to provide insights in real time.

trans-unit.source: Social media analytics tools help organizations understand trending topics, meaning subjects and attitudes with a high volume of posts in social media.
trans-unit.target: Social media analytics tools help organizations understand trending topics, meaning subjects and attitudes with a high volume of posts in social media.

trans-unit.source: Sentiment analysis - also called "opinion mining" - uses social media analytics tools to determine attitudes toward a product, idea, and so on.
trans-unit.target: Sentiment analysis - also called "opinion mining" - uses social media analytics tools to determine attitudes toward a product, idea, and so on.

trans-unit.source: A news media website is interested in getting an edge over its competitors by featuring site content that is immediately relevant to its readers.
trans-unit.target: A news media website is interested in getting an edge over its competitors by featuring site content that is immediately relevant to its readers.

trans-unit.source: They use social media analysis on topics relevant to their readers by doing real time sentiment analysis on Twitter data.
trans-unit.target: They use social media analysis on topics relevant to their readers by doing real time sentiment analysis on Twitter data.

trans-unit.source: Specifically, to identify what topics are trending in real time on Twitter, they need real-time analytics about the tweet volume and sentiment for key topics.
trans-unit.target: Specifically, to identify what topics are trending in real time on Twitter, they need real-time analytics about the tweet volume and sentiment for key topics.

trans-unit.source: A Twitter account is required for this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: A Twitter account is required for this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: This walkthough uses a Twitter client application which is located on GitHub.
trans-unit.target: This walkthough uses a Twitter client application which is located on GitHub.

trans-unit.source: Download it <linkText>here</linkText><title></title> and follow the steps below to set up your solution.
trans-unit.target: Download it <linkText>here</linkText><title></title> and follow the steps below to set up your solution.

trans-unit.source: The sample application will generate events and push them to an Event Hubs instance (an Event Hub, for short).
trans-unit.target: The sample application will generate events and push them to an Event Hubs instance (an Event Hub, for short).

trans-unit.source: Service Bus Event Hubs are the preferred method of event ingestion for Stream Analytics.
trans-unit.target: Service Bus Event Hubs are the preferred method of event ingestion for Stream Analytics.

trans-unit.source: See Event Hubs documentation in <linkText>Service Bus documentation</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: See Event Hubs documentation in <linkText>Service Bus documentation</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Follow the steps below to create an Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: Follow the steps below to create an Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Portal click NEW > APP SERVICES > SERVICE BUS > EVENT HUB > QUICK CREATE and provide a name, region, and new or existing namespace to create a new Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Portal click NEW > APP SERVICES > SERVICE BUS > EVENT HUB > QUICK CREATE and provide a name, region, and new or existing namespace to create a new Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: As a best practice, each Stream Analytics job should read from a single Event Hubs Consumer Group.
trans-unit.target: As a best practice, each Stream Analytics job should read from a single Event Hubs Consumer Group.

trans-unit.source: We will walk you through the process of creating a Consumer Group below and you can learn more about them here.
trans-unit.target: We will walk you through the process of creating a Consumer Group below and you can learn more about them here.

trans-unit.source: To create a Consumer Group, navigate to the newly created Event Hub and click the CONSUMER GROUPS tab, then click CREATE on the bottom of the page and provide a name for your Consumer Group.
trans-unit.target: To create a Consumer Group, navigate to the newly created Event Hub and click the CONSUMER GROUPS tab, then click CREATE on the bottom of the page and provide a name for your Consumer Group.

trans-unit.source: To grant access to the Event Hub, we will need to create a shared access policy.
trans-unit.target: To grant access to the Event Hub, we will need to create a shared access policy.

trans-unit.source: Click the CONFIGURE tab of your Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: Click the CONFIGURE tab of your Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: Under SHARED ACCESS POLICIES, create a new policy with MANAGE permissions.
trans-unit.target: Under SHARED ACCESS POLICIES, create a new policy with MANAGE permissions.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Shared Access Policies where you can create a policy with Manage permissions.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Shared Access Policies where you can create a policy with Manage permissions.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click SAVE at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click SAVE at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to the DASHBOARD and click CONNECTION INFORMATION at the bottom of the page and copy and save the connection information.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to the DASHBOARD and click CONNECTION INFORMATION at the bottom of the page and copy and save the connection information.

trans-unit.source: (Use the copy icon that appears under the search icon.)
trans-unit.target: (Use the copy icon that appears under the search icon.)

trans-unit.source: We have provided a client application that will tap into Twitter data via <linkText>Twitter's Streaming APIs</linkText><title></title> to collect Tweet events about a parameterized set of topics.
trans-unit.target: We have provided a client application that will tap into Twitter data via <linkText>Twitter's Streaming APIs</linkText><title></title> to collect Tweet events about a parameterized set of topics.

trans-unit.source: The 3rd party open source tool <linkText>Sentiment140</linkText><title></title> is used to assign a sentiment value to each tweet (0: negative, 2: neutral, 4: positive) and then Tweet events are pushed to Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: The 3rd party open source tool <linkText>Sentiment140</linkText><title></title> is used to assign a sentiment value to each tweet (0: negative, 2: neutral, 4: positive) and then Tweet events are pushed to Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to set up the application:
trans-unit.target: Follow these steps to set up the application:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Download the TwitterClient solution</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Download the TwitterClient solution</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Open App.config and replace oauthconsumerkey, oauthconsumersecret, oauthtoken, oauthtoken_secret with Twitter tokens with your values.
trans-unit.target: Open App.config and replace oauthconsumerkey, oauthconsumersecret, oauthtoken, oauthtoken_secret with Twitter tokens with your values.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Steps to generate an OAuth access token</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Steps to generate an OAuth access token</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Note that you will need to make an empty application to generate a token.
trans-unit.target: Note that you will need to make an empty application to generate a token.

trans-unit.source: Replace the EventHubConnectionString and EventHubName values in App.config with your Event Hub connection string and name.
trans-unit.target: Replace the EventHubConnectionString and EventHubName values in App.config with your Event Hub connection string and name.

trans-unit.source: Optional: Adjust the keywords to search for.
trans-unit.target: Optional: Adjust the keywords to search for.

trans-unit.source: As a default, this application looks for "Azure,Skype,XBox,Microsoft,Seattle".
trans-unit.target: As a default, this application looks for "Azure,Skype,XBox,Microsoft,Seattle".

trans-unit.source: You can adjust the values for twitter_keywords in App.config, if desired.
trans-unit.target: You can adjust the values for twitter_keywords in App.config, if desired.

trans-unit.source: Build the solution
trans-unit.target: Build the solution

trans-unit.source: Start the application.
trans-unit.target: Start the application.

trans-unit.source: You will see Tweet events with the CreatedAt, Topic, and SentimentScore values being sent to your Event Hub:
trans-unit.target: You will see Tweet events with the CreatedAt, Topic, and SentimentScore values being sent to your Event Hub:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Sentiment analysis: SentimentScore values sent to an event hub.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Sentiment analysis: SentimentScore values sent to an event hub.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Now that we have Tweet events streaming in real-time from Twitter, we can set up a Stream Analytics job to analyze these events in real time.
trans-unit.target: Now that we have Tweet events streaming in real-time from Twitter, we can set up a Stream Analytics job to analyze these events in real time.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Portal, click NEW > DATA SERVICES > STREAM ANALYTICS > QUICK CREATE.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Portal, click NEW > DATA SERVICES > STREAM ANALYTICS > QUICK CREATE.

trans-unit.source: Specify the following values, and then click CREATE STREAM ANALYTICS JOB:
trans-unit.target: Specify the following values, and then click CREATE STREAM ANALYTICS JOB:

trans-unit.source: JOB NAME: Enter a job name.
trans-unit.target: JOB NAME: Enter a job name.

trans-unit.source: REGION: Select the region where you want to run the job.
trans-unit.target: REGION: Select the region where you want to run the job.

trans-unit.source: Consider placing the job and the event hub in the same region to ensure better performance and to ensure that you will not be paying to transfer data between regions.
trans-unit.target: Consider placing the job and the event hub in the same region to ensure better performance and to ensure that you will not be paying to transfer data between regions.

trans-unit.source: STORAGE ACCOUNT: Choose the Storage account that you would like to use to store monitoring data for all Stream Analytics jobs running within this region.
trans-unit.target: STORAGE ACCOUNT: Choose the Storage account that you would like to use to store monitoring data for all Stream Analytics jobs running within this region.

trans-unit.source: You have the option to choose an existing Storage account or to create a new one.
trans-unit.target: You have the option to choose an existing Storage account or to create a new one.

trans-unit.source: Click STREAM ANALYTICS in the left pane to list the Stream Analytics jobs.
trans-unit.target: Click STREAM ANALYTICS in the left pane to list the Stream Analytics jobs.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Stream Analytics service icon</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Stream Analytics service icon</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The new job will be shown with a status of CREATED.
trans-unit.target: The new job will be shown with a status of CREATED.

trans-unit.source: Notice that the START button on the bottom of the page is disabled.
trans-unit.target: Notice that the START button on the bottom of the page is disabled.

trans-unit.source: You must configure the job input, output, and query before you can start the job.
trans-unit.target: You must configure the job input, output, and query before you can start the job.

trans-unit.source: In your Stream Analytics job click INPUTS from the top of the page, and then click ADD INPUT.
trans-unit.target: In your Stream Analytics job click INPUTS from the top of the page, and then click ADD INPUT.

trans-unit.source: The dialog that opens will walk you through a number of steps to set up your input.
trans-unit.target: The dialog that opens will walk you through a number of steps to set up your input.

trans-unit.source: Select DATA STREAM, and then click the right button.
trans-unit.target: Select DATA STREAM, and then click the right button.

trans-unit.source: Select EVENT HUB, and then click the right button.
trans-unit.target: Select EVENT HUB, and then click the right button.

trans-unit.source: Type or select the following values on the third page:
trans-unit.target: Type or select the following values on the third page:

trans-unit.source: INPUT ALIAS: Enter a friendly name for this job input, such as TwitterStream.
trans-unit.target: INPUT ALIAS: Enter a friendly name for this job input, such as TwitterStream.

trans-unit.source: Note that you will be using this name in the query later on.
trans-unit.target: Note that you will be using this name in the query later on.

trans-unit.source: EVENT HUB: If the Event Hub you created is in the same subscription as the Stream Analytics job, select the namespace that the event hub is in.
trans-unit.target: EVENT HUB: If the Event Hub you created is in the same subscription as the Stream Analytics job, select the namespace that the event hub is in.

trans-unit.source: If your event hub is in a different subscription, select Use Event Hub from Another Subscription, and then manually enter information for SERVICE BUS NAMESPACE, EVENT HUB NAME, EVENT HUB POLICY NAME, EVENT HUB POLICY KEY, and EVENT HUB PARTITION COUNT.
trans-unit.target: If your event hub is in a different subscription, select Use Event Hub from Another Subscription, and then manually enter information for SERVICE BUS NAMESPACE, EVENT HUB NAME, EVENT HUB POLICY NAME, EVENT HUB POLICY KEY, and EVENT HUB PARTITION COUNT.

trans-unit.source: EVENT HUB NAME: Select the name of the Event Hub
trans-unit.target: EVENT HUB NAME: Select the name of the Event Hub

trans-unit.source: EVENT HUB POLICY NAME: Select the event-hub policy created earlier in this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: EVENT HUB POLICY NAME: Select the event-hub policy created earlier in this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: EVENT HUB CONSUMER GROUP: Type in the Consumer Group created earlier in this tutorial.
trans-unit.target: EVENT HUB CONSUMER GROUP: Type in the Consumer Group created earlier in this tutorial.

trans-unit.source: Click the right button.
trans-unit.target: Click the right button.

trans-unit.source: Specify the following values:
trans-unit.target: Specify the following values:

trans-unit.source: EVENT SERIALIZER FORMAT: JSON
trans-unit.target: EVENT SERIALIZER FORMAT: JSON

trans-unit.source: ENCODING: UTF8
trans-unit.target: ENCODING: UTF8

trans-unit.source: Click the check button to add this source and to verify that Stream Analytics can successfully connect to the event hub.
trans-unit.target: Click the check button to add this source and to verify that Stream Analytics can successfully connect to the event hub.

trans-unit.source: Stream Analytics supports a simple, declarative query model for describing transformations.
trans-unit.target: Stream Analytics supports a simple, declarative query model for describing transformations.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about the language, see the <linkText>Azure Stream Analytics Query Language Reference</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: To learn more about the language, see the <linkText>Azure Stream Analytics Query Language Reference</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial will help you author and test several queries over Twitter data.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial will help you author and test several queries over Twitter data.

trans-unit.source: To validate your query against actual job data, you can use the SAMPLE DATA feature to extract events from your stream and create a .JSON file of the events for testing.
trans-unit.target: To validate your query against actual job data, you can use the SAMPLE DATA feature to extract events from your stream and create a .JSON file of the events for testing.

trans-unit.source: Select on your Event Hub input and click SAMPLE DATA at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Select on your Event Hub input and click SAMPLE DATA at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: In the dialog that appears, specify a START TIME to start collecting data from and a DURATION for how much additional data to consume.
trans-unit.target: In the dialog that appears, specify a START TIME to start collecting data from and a DURATION for how much additional data to consume.

trans-unit.source: Click the DETAILS button, and then the Click here link to download and save the .JSON file that is generated.
trans-unit.target: Click the DETAILS button, and then the Click here link to download and save the .JSON file that is generated.

trans-unit.source: To start with, we will do a simple pass-through query that projects all the fields in an event.
trans-unit.target: To start with, we will do a simple pass-through query that projects all the fields in an event.

trans-unit.source: Click QUERY from the top of the Stream Analytics job page.
trans-unit.target: Click QUERY from the top of the Stream Analytics job page.

trans-unit.source: In the code editor, replace the initial query template with the following:
trans-unit.target: In the code editor, replace the initial query template with the following:

trans-unit.source: Make sure that the name of the input source matches the name of the input you specified earlier.
trans-unit.target: Make sure that the name of the input source matches the name of the input you specified earlier.

trans-unit.source: Click TEST under the query editor
trans-unit.target: Click TEST under the query editor

trans-unit.source: Browse to your sample .JSON file
trans-unit.target: Browse to your sample .JSON file

trans-unit.source: Click the check button and see the results displayed below the query definition.
trans-unit.target: Click the check button and see the results displayed below the query definition.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Results displayed below query definition</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Results displayed below query definition</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To compare the number of mentions between topics, we'll leverage a <linkText>TumblingWindow</linkText><title></title> to get the count of mentions by topic every 5 seconds.
trans-unit.target: To compare the number of mentions between topics, we'll leverage a <linkText>TumblingWindow</linkText><title></title> to get the count of mentions by topic every 5 seconds.

trans-unit.source: Change the query in the code editor to:
trans-unit.target: Change the query in the code editor to:

trans-unit.source: Note that this query uses the TIMESTAMP BY keyword to specify a timestamp field in the payload to be used in the temporal computation.
trans-unit.target: Note that this query uses the TIMESTAMP BY keyword to specify a timestamp field in the payload to be used in the temporal computation.

trans-unit.source: If this field wasn't specified, the windowing operation would be performed using the time each event arrived at Event Hub.
trans-unit.target: If this field wasn't specified, the windowing operation would be performed using the time each event arrived at Event Hub.

trans-unit.source: Learn more under "Arrival Time Vs Application Time" in the <linkText>Stream Analytics Query Reference</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Learn more under "Arrival Time Vs Application Time" in the <linkText>Stream Analytics Query Reference</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This query also accesses a timestamp for the end of each window with System.Timestamp.
trans-unit.target: This query also accesses a timestamp for the end of each window with System.Timestamp.

trans-unit.source: Click RERUN under the query editor to see the results of the query.
trans-unit.target: Click RERUN under the query editor to see the results of the query.

trans-unit.source: To identify trending topics we'll look for topics that cross a threshold value for mentions in a given amount of time.
trans-unit.target: To identify trending topics we'll look for topics that cross a threshold value for mentions in a given amount of time.

trans-unit.source: For the purposes of this tutorial, we'll check for topics that are mentioned more than 20 times in the last 5 seconds using a <linkText>SlidingWindow</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For the purposes of this tutorial, we'll check for topics that are mentioned more than 20 times in the last 5 seconds using a <linkText>SlidingWindow</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Change the query in the code editor to:
trans-unit.target: Change the query in the code editor to:

trans-unit.source: Click RERUN under the query editor to see the results of the query.
trans-unit.target: Click RERUN under the query editor to see the results of the query.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Sliding Window query output</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Sliding Window query output</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The final query we will test uses a TumblingWindow to obtain the number of mentions and average, minimum, maximum, and standard deviation of sentiment score for each topic every 5 seconds.
trans-unit.target: The final query we will test uses a TumblingWindow to obtain the number of mentions and average, minimum, maximum, and standard deviation of sentiment score for each topic every 5 seconds.

trans-unit.source: Change the query in the code editor to:
trans-unit.target: Change the query in the code editor to:

trans-unit.source: Click RERUN under the query editor to see the results of the query.
trans-unit.target: Click RERUN under the query editor to see the results of the query.

trans-unit.source: This is the query we will use for our dashboard.
trans-unit.target: This is the query we will use for our dashboard.

trans-unit.source: Click SAVE at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click SAVE at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: Now that we have defined an event stream, an Event Hub input to ingest events, and a query to perform a transformation over the stream, the last step is to define an output sink for the job.
trans-unit.target: Now that we have defined an event stream, an Event Hub input to ingest events, and a query to perform a transformation over the stream, the last step is to define an output sink for the job.

trans-unit.source: We'll write the aggregated tweet events from our job query to an Azure Blob.
trans-unit.target: We'll write the aggregated tweet events from our job query to an Azure Blob.

trans-unit.source: You could also push your results to SQL Database, Table Store or Event Hub, depending on your specific application needs.
trans-unit.target: You could also push your results to SQL Database, Table Store or Event Hub, depending on your specific application needs.

trans-unit.source: Follow the steps below to create a container for Blob storage, if you don't already have one:
trans-unit.target: Follow the steps below to create a container for Blob storage, if you don't already have one:

trans-unit.source: Use an existing Storage account or create a new Storage account by clicking NEW > DATA SERVICES > STORAGE > QUICK CREATE > and following the instructions on the screen.
trans-unit.target: Use an existing Storage account or create a new Storage account by clicking NEW > DATA SERVICES > STORAGE > QUICK CREATE > and following the instructions on the screen.

trans-unit.source: Select the Storage account and then click CONTAINERS at the top of the page, and then click ADD.
trans-unit.target: Select the Storage account and then click CONTAINERS at the top of the page, and then click ADD.

trans-unit.source: Specify a NAME for your container and set its ACCESS to Public Blob.
trans-unit.target: Specify a NAME for your container and set its ACCESS to Public Blob.

trans-unit.source: In your Stream Analytics job, click OUTPUT at the top of the page, and then click ADD OUTPUT.
trans-unit.target: In your Stream Analytics job, click OUTPUT at the top of the page, and then click ADD OUTPUT.

trans-unit.source: The dialog that opens will walk you through a number of steps to set up your output.
trans-unit.target: The dialog that opens will walk you through a number of steps to set up your output.

trans-unit.source: Select BLOB STORAGE, and then click the right button.
trans-unit.target: Select BLOB STORAGE, and then click the right button.

trans-unit.source: Type or select the following values on the third page:
trans-unit.target: Type or select the following values on the third page:

trans-unit.source: OUTPUT ALIAS: Enter a friendly name for this job output
trans-unit.target: OUTPUT ALIAS: Enter a friendly name for this job output

trans-unit.source: SUBSCRIPTION: If the Blob Storage you created is in the same subscription as the Stream Analytics job, select Use Storage Account from Current Subscription.
trans-unit.target: SUBSCRIPTION: If the Blob Storage you created is in the same subscription as the Stream Analytics job, select Use Storage Account from Current Subscription.

trans-unit.source: If your storage is in a different subscription, select Use Storage Account from Another Subscription and manually enter information for STORAGE ACCOUNT, STORAGE ACCOUNT KEY, CONTAINER.
trans-unit.target: If your storage is in a different subscription, select Use Storage Account from Another Subscription and manually enter information for STORAGE ACCOUNT, STORAGE ACCOUNT KEY, CONTAINER.

trans-unit.source: STORAGE ACCOUNT: Select the name of the Storage Account
trans-unit.target: STORAGE ACCOUNT: Select the name of the Storage Account

trans-unit.source: CONTAINER: Select the name of the Container
trans-unit.target: CONTAINER: Select the name of the Container

trans-unit.source: FILENAME PREFIX: Type in a file prefix to use when writing blob output
trans-unit.target: FILENAME PREFIX: Type in a file prefix to use when writing blob output

trans-unit.source: Click the right button.
trans-unit.target: Click the right button.

trans-unit.source: Specify the following values:
trans-unit.target: Specify the following values:

trans-unit.source: EVENT SERIALIZER FORMAT: JSON
trans-unit.target: EVENT SERIALIZER FORMAT: JSON

trans-unit.source: ENCODING: UTF8
trans-unit.target: ENCODING: UTF8

trans-unit.source: Click the check button to add this source and to verify that Stream Analytics can successfully connect to the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Click the check button to add this source and to verify that Stream Analytics can successfully connect to the storage account.

trans-unit.source: Since a job input, query and output have all been specified, we are ready to start the Stream Analytics job.
trans-unit.target: Since a job input, query and output have all been specified, we are ready to start the Stream Analytics job.

trans-unit.source: From the job DASHBOARD, click START at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: From the job DASHBOARD, click START at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: In the dialog that appears, select JOB START TIME, and then click the checkmark button on the bottom of the dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the dialog that appears, select JOB START TIME, and then click the checkmark button on the bottom of the dialog.

trans-unit.source: The job status will change to Starting and will shortly move to Running.
trans-unit.target: The job status will change to Starting and will shortly move to Running.

trans-unit.source: Once your job is running and processing the real-time Twitter stream, choose how you want to view the output for sentiment analysis.
trans-unit.target: Once your job is running and processing the real-time Twitter stream, choose how you want to view the output for sentiment analysis.

trans-unit.source: Use a tool like <linkText>Azure Storage Explorer</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>Azure Explorer</linkText><title></title> to view your job output in real time.
trans-unit.target: Use a tool like <linkText>Azure Storage Explorer</linkText><title></title> or <linkText>Azure Explorer</linkText><title></title> to view your job output in real time.

trans-unit.source: From here, you could extend your application to include a customized dashboard over your output, like the one pictured below using <linkText>Power BI</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: From here, you could extend your application to include a customized dashboard over your output, like the one pictured below using <linkText>Power BI</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Social media analysis: Stream Analytics sentiment analysis (opinion mining) output in a Power BI dashboard.</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Social media analysis: Stream Analytics sentiment analysis (opinion mining) output in a Power BI dashboard.</linkText>

trans-unit.source: For further assistance, try our <linkText>Azure Stream Analytics forum</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For further assistance, try our <linkText>Azure Stream Analytics forum</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Introduction to Azure Stream Analytics</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Introduction to Azure Stream Analytics</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Get started using Azure Stream Analytics</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Get started using Azure Stream Analytics</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scale Azure Stream Analytics jobs</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scale Azure Stream Analytics jobs</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure Stream Analytics Query Language Reference</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Stream Analytics Query Language Reference</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure Stream Analytics Management REST API Reference</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Stream Analytics Management REST API Reference</linkText><title></title>
